author: RUSANMA
post_text: May 5, 2020 at 5:35 PM#1Hi. the case is that I have a plugin that when executing orders creates sequences with name (*). any macro suggestion to remove all sequences with this name?Thank youRuben S.

posts.author: RUSANMA
posts.post_text: May 5, 2020 at 5:35 PM#1Hi. the case is that I have a plugin that when executing orders creates sequences with name (*). any macro suggestion to remove all sequences with this name?Thank youRuben S.

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 5, 2020 at 6:04 PM#2that is a bad choice for sequence name.I would strongly suggest to rewrite your plugin.--you will need to use plugin or commandline embedded Lua, and examine the label of every sequence, to do this, e.gCodeLUA "local g=gma.show.getobj; for i=1,9999 do if g.label(g.handle('seq '..i))=='*' then gma.cmd('del seq '..i..' /nc') end ; end"

posts.author: RUSANMA
posts.post_text: May 6, 2020 at 12:14 PM#3I have copied the command line that you have described inmy LUA plugin but still doesn't work. keeps generating sequences (*) every time I run a macro

posts.author: F Dijkers
posts.post_text: May 6, 2020 at 12:37 PM#4Hi,Then I guess the syntax of your macro is wrong. As glad already mentioned, * is a very bad name for basically everything in MA, since it used to be a wildcard for strings.Kind regards,Floris DijkersLighting Director & Designerflorisdijkers.comlighting@florisdijkers.com

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 6, 2020 at 12:51 PM#5My example would not fix your plugin.it was intended to be pasted into the commandline to tidy the mess you plugin had created.

title: DELETE SEQUENCES LABEL= *
